Debriefing:

One year has passed since the first Xannarian War. Sampa, though barely surviving his encounter with Xannari, has been left mentally scarred (so Citadel psychologists say). With the final defeat of Xannari, Sampa was hailed as a hero. Upon speaking with him myself, however, I do not see him as such. He is only a small man trying to atone for his mistakes. I suppose that, given the circumstances which he was faced with, anyone would crack under the pressure.

Over the past year, while Sampa recovered, he acted as a liaison for the Cerberus government in the Citadel. This is only a temporary arrangement while he recovers. I suppose it was only natural that since the Citadel is his child that he should play an active role in its use as a government. Politically, the Citadel turned out to be the best thing for the galaxy, not the white elephant that many believed it would be. Since the events of last year, countless new factions have set up embassies in the Citadel and applied to be on the council. I believe that things are on the up and up for this galaxy.

Cerberus has not forgotten the court martial however, and at the beginning of this year, scheduled the first meeting. to see if he has recovered enough, mentally, to begin his trial. I do not want to think about what will occur if they find him guilty of the charges. Even now, Sampa prepares to go to the Cerberus Admiralty for the meeting.

Admiral Hackett

C-Sec

(hope you guys appreciate this small prologue I wrote to kick off Part II. Thought to write it from the eyes of another character.)
